top_comment.text:
The only thing I notice, while this is awesome, is that you are playing 
Doom 1 and not Doom2 which brutal doom was practically designed for.

You can tell straight away from the fact that there is no menu_help 
(normally f1 key) screen for Doom 1 and only Doom 2. 

On top of that, I don't think the extra weapons like the Reverent guns, 
rail gun, BFG 10000 (as well as the 9000 version), and other extra weapons 
exist in Doom 1s version. Correct me if I'm wrong.﻿

+raptorboy1043 The mod is great, don't get me wrong. I play it very 
regularly. I was just saying that if ID were to hire him it might cause 
some uproar among the fanbase, partly because hipsters think his mod ruins 
what made Doom great, and partly because some people don't like the guy. 
But if ID didn't care about people's reactions to him (which I'm pretty 
sure they don't, which actually contradicts my first comment, sorry about 
that :P) then I think he'd be a pretty cool addition to the team.

captions.text:
Like a fine wine, Doom has been aging to perfection.
Every year Doom gets more and more mods made

for it, and finally perfection has happened;
Brutal Doom is a mod that has fully reinvented
Doom yet again just take a look

The Doom modding community has been active
pretty much since the game's inception, creating

new levels, changing game mechanics, and doing
all manner of amazing things with the Doom

engine. Now, to get these great mods to work
you are going to need to download a Doom source

port. There are many to choose from, but my
personal favorite is GZDoom. Essentially,

what this program, and others like it does,
is make Doom run on a modern PC without Dos

Box, but that isn't all - these programs allow
you to change the controls to more modern

ones, which translate very well to the game.
Also, you can get increased screen resolutions,

so now you can play Doom in 1080p and damn
does it look good.

Back to Brutal Doom, all of the weapons have
new sprites and have reloading animations.

They also have new sound effects as well;
the bloody shotgun sounds like the HAMMER

OF THE GODS! That's just about as orgasmic
as the base shotgun sound effect, the mod

removes the pistol and instead gives you a
combat rifle, which you can and must aim with,

this is a great starting weapon as it has
a good rate of fire, and great range, the

rest of the weapons are pretty much like their
classic counterparts, but unlike in vanilla

Doom, you can't just rely on the shotgun to
see you through the game, because the monsters

have been tweaked to be faster and more difficult,
hell even the zombie man is a threat now,

and imps can snipe you from across the map,
you have to use the right weapons at the right
times, and if you don't you are dead

This mod introduces a few other things as
well, you can make vulgar gestures, and you

can kick enemies Duke Nuke style, but the
best thing by far are the executions. If you

sneak up on an enemy you can break their necks
- if you get the berserk powerup, you can

become an avatar of destruction! Also, some
enemies drop the demon strength, time to rip
and tear.

Do I recommend it? Oh yeah, I recommend it
to so many people. First, if you have just

been playing the innumerable console ports
of Doom I implore you get the PC version and

discover that Doom is not merely a curiosity,
it is alive and well and still growing. Second,

if you have been looking for a classic FPS
but you have played the majority and are sick

of Doom after playing it two million times,
get this mod; it reinvents Doom to the point

where it is almost like a new game. So this
is Jon wishing you good Gunman Chronicles,
good Descent or whatever makes you happy.

title: CGR Undertow - BRUTAL DOOM review for PC
